title: "Exploring Magnétisme Animal and Hypnosis in Literature"
first_phrase: This text presents various works on animal magnetism and their impact on fixing public opinion. It includes the works of Deleuze, Hervier, Cullerre, Mesmer, Thouvenel, Baudouin Frères, Braid, and Bourzeis. Also, it references Girardin's Observations and Bombay's Procédés, addressing the examination of animal magnetism by the Royal Society of Medicine. These works contributed to the progress of hypnosis and magnetism in medicine. This final part focuses on the examination of the members of the Academy of Medicine on the issue.

last_phrase: There is a vast selection of literature regarding the study of hypnosis and animal magnetism, which can provide valuable information for those interested in this topic. From the observations and discoveries of Mesmer and Thouvenel in the 18th century, to the more contemporary works of Erickson and Kappas, readers can explore different approaches to hypnosis and its applications, including sex therapy and self-improvement techniques.
